float_compressor.py¶

Contains the functions used to compress data into binary .bit files

alt_data_compressor(fname, savefile, cut):

Alternative compression method with respect to the one involving the neural network. It transforms the floats of a dataset into bitarrays, then cuts a part of their mantissa by turning it into zeroes, turns the dataset elements back into floats, and finally saves the data into a .bit file after compressing it with the fpzip algorithm.

Parameters:

  • fname (str) – name of the file containing the data to be compressed

  • savefile (str) – name of the file where the compressed data will be stored

  • cut (int) – number of mantissa bits that will be turned into zeroes

Raises:

OSError – if file does not exist

bin_data_compressor(fname, savefile):

Compression method to be used on the data previously compressed with compressor.py. It turns the floats into bitarrays and compresses them with the fpzip algorithm, making it possible to compare the normalizing flow compression with the mantissa cut compression described above.

Parameters:

  • fname (str) – name of the file containing the data to be compressed

  • savefile (str) – name of the file where the compressed data will be stored

Raises:

OSError – if file does not exist

NormFlow compression
